comment: I suppose that this is more of a hybrid American/English Barleywine as the recipe calls for Challenger hops. I've read or have been told that in late 19th century England grain bills for strong ales were very often comprised of just base malt and a single bittering charge of whatever hop the brewer had at the time. I have a difficult time sensing the 'bready' characteristic in Marris Otter that supposedly sets is apart from standard American 2 row. So, for the sake of saving a few dollars I'm going to forgo the MO and opt for American 2 row.
